articles.title: Kim Jong Un's Line and Policies for National Reunification Supported by Women's Union Chief
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un's Line and Policies for National Reunification Supported by Women's Union Chief
 Pyongyang, May 29 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Sun, chairwoman of the Central Committee of the Democratic Women's Union of Korea, in a statement on Sunday noted that supreme leader Kim Jong Un's indication of the line and policies for national reunification at the Seventh Congress of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK) was an event in the nation's history as they provided a fresh turning occasion in realizing the cause of independent reunification.
					 Receiving the tasks for national reunification set forth by Kim Jong Un at the Seventh Congress of the WPK as important guidelines and immortal banner that clearly indicated the path for achieving independent reunification, peace and prosperity by the concerted efforts of all Koreans, the chairwoman enthusiastically supported them reflecting the mind of all members of the women's union and other women.
					
					 To defuse the danger of a war and tensions and create a peaceful environment is a fundamental precondition for reunifying the country, she said, adding:
					
					 All the Korean women at home and abroad who oppose war and aspire after peace and reunification will have to wage a high-pitched campaign for peace against war to frustrate war drills and arms buildup of the U.S. and the south Korean authorities that seriously threaten the destiny of the fellow countrymen and create obstacles to the improvement of the north-south relations.
					
					 Taking ourselves of this opportunity, we ardently call on the women of various circles in south Korea to take the lead in carrying out the most and reasonable reunification proposal of the WPK that reflects the will and wishes of all Koreans for reunification and paving the path for reunification by getting firmly united under the banner of By Our Nation Itself.
					
					 All the women in the DPRK will fulfill their responsibility and duty in the sacred patriotic cause of building a dignified and prospering reunified power, cherishing deep the great pride and self-confidence of being led by Kim Jong Un, the sun of the nation and lodestar for national reunification.

articles.title: Papers Accuse S. Korean Chief Executive of Turning down DPRK's Proposal for Dialogue
articles.content:
S. Korean Chief Executive Accused of Turning down DPRK's Proposal for Dialogue
 Pyongyang, May 29 (KCNA) -- Newspapers here Sunday in their commentaries denounce the south Korean authorities for taking an improper attitude of turning down the DPRK's proposal for dialogue.
					 Shortly ago, a spokesman for the Ministry of Unification of south Korea talked nonsense that the DPRK's proposal for north-south military authorities' talks is aimed to incite "conflict in south" and make "a crack in the international sanctions against the north". A spokesman for the Ministry of Defense also took negative attitude toward the proposal, talking volumes about the "will for denuclearization" and "practical action."
					
					 The south Korean ruling quarters' unreasonable denial of the proposal is nothing but a very irresponsible and imprudent behavior, Rodong Sinmun says, and goes on:
					
					 It is the unshakable stand and will of the DPRK to solve the issue of the inter-Korean relations facing catastrophe through dialogue and negotiations, not by confrontation and military clash.
					
					 The north-south relations reached an extreme politico-military standoff.
					
					 Dialogue and negotiations are the way for putting the grave situation under control.
					
					 The south Korean authorities are rebuffed and condemned by the public for having pushed the inter-Korean relations to the worst catastrophe and created the extreme danger of war by pursuing the unprecedented confrontation policy. It would be nothing bad in every aspect for them to accept the DPRK's proposal for dialogue.
					
					 They had better stop misleading the public over the issue of dialogue and behave themselves, clearly understanding the DPRK's will for dialogue for detente and peace on the Korean peninsula and improved inter-Korean relations.
					
					 Minju Joson warns that if the south Korean authorities turn down the DPRK's sincere proposal for dialogue with far-fetched assertions quite contrary to the trend of the times and the public mind-set, they will only commit indelible disgrace and crimes to be recorded in the history of the nation.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun on World Progressives' Trust in WPK
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun on World Progressives' Trust in WPK
 Pyongyang, May 29 (KCNA) -- The world progressives are praising, trusting and following the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK) as it has performed great and distinguished feats for the cause of human independence, says Rodong Sinmun Sunday in an article.
					 The WPK set a shining example in building a revolutionary party in the era of independence, the article notes, and goes on:
					
					 The WPK is the banner of victory as it has dynamically steered the popular masses' cause of independence, the cause of socialism.
					
					 The Pyongyang declaration which calls for defending and advancing the socialist cause was provided thanks to the initiative and efforts of the WPK. The declaration serves as the action programme common to the revolutionary parties of the world and encourages the revolutionary people in their struggle to deal blows at the imperialists in their moves against socialism and to rebuild it.
					
					 Steadfast are the faith and will of the progressives to accomplish the cause of global independence by following the ever-victorious WPK.
					
					 Organizations for studying Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism, the guiding idea of the WPK, have been inaugurated in many countries.
					
					 The world revolutionary people are deeply studying and grasping the WPK's theory on building the party and experience gained by it.
					
					 Joint seminars of political parties and organizations on the theory and exploits of the WPK performed in building the party, lectures, reading sessions and round-table talks have taken place in every part of the world.
					
					 The sacred cause of the popular masses for independence, the cause of the great party guided by Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism, is sure to win.
					
					 The trend of the times deeply trusting the WPK together with the ever-victorious history will grow stronger on this planet, the article concludes.

articles.title: S. Korean Primary School Teachers Reject State-complied History Textbook
articles.content:
S. Korean Primary School Teachers Reject State-complied History Textbook
 Pyongyang, May 29 (KCNA) -- At least 2 570 primary school teachers across south Korea released a statement on May 25 in the name of all primary school teachers calling for correctly teaching the national history, according to CBS of south Korea.
					 The history textbook for 6th year pupils of primary schools whose screening the "government" okayed is peppered with contents eulogizing the erstwhile dictatorial regime such as justifying the May 16 coup and contains no photos related to sexual slavery enforced by the Japanese imperialists, the statement charged.
					
					 Noting it is dangerous to teach the pupils the twisted history, it protested against the regime, declaring the will not to teach pupils history with the above-said textbook.

articles.title: S. Korean Pro-reunification Activists Sentenced to Prison Terms
articles.content:
S. Korean Pro-reunification Activists Sentenced to Prison Terms
 Pyongyang, May 29 (KCNA) -- The Seoul High Court of south Korea at an appeal trial of the co-representative and two other members of the Korea Solidarity for Independent Reunification and Democracy sentenced them to prison terms on May 26, according to the south Korean Newsis.
					 The security authorities indicted them for violation of the "Security Law" on charges that they staged actions for independence against the U.S. and the "government", justified the north's nuclear test and Yonphyong Island shelling and possessed and distributed copies of their organ containing stories "benefiting enemy."
					
					 The court dismissed the appeal with unreasonable assertions and upheld the earlier decision of sentencing them to 2 years in prison and 3 years of suspension of qualifications.

articles.title: S. Koreans Urge Obama to Apologize to Korean Victims of A-bomb Disasters
articles.content:
S. Koreans Urge Obama to Apologize to Korean Victims of A-bomb Disasters
 Pyongyang, May 29 (KCNA) -- The People for Achieving Peace and Reunification and other civic and social bodies of south Korea held a press conference outside the U.S. embassy in Seoul on May 26 as regards Obama's junket to Hiroshima.
					 Speakers there recalled that a lot of Koreans, who had been taken to Japan due to conscriptions and labor drafting by the Japanese imperialists, fell victim to A-bombs dropped by the U.S.
					
					 Obama's reckless remarks at an interview that he has no will to apologize to victims reveal his intention to help Japan clear its disgrace as a war criminal state and justify its militarist traces, far from making a sincere reflection on the A-bombs dropping, they said, adding:
					
					 Obama should make an apology to the Korean victims of A-bomb disasters without fail.

articles.title: Korean Youth in Japan Denounce S. Korean Regime's Abduction of DPRK Citizens
articles.content:
Korean Youth in Japan Denounce S. Korean Regime's Abduction of DPRK Citizens
Pyongyang, May 29 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Ju, chairman of the Central Standing Committee of the Korean Youth League in Japan, released a statement on May 26 in protest against the south Korean regime's allurement and abduction of DPRK women citizens.
					 All Korean youths and students in Japan hardly repress their bitterest anger at the south Korean regime's hideous act of terrorism, the group allurement and abduction of the DPRK women citizens before taking them to south Korea, the statement said, adding:
					
					 The south Korean authorities are forcing the abductees to "defect" through all sorts of appeasement, deception, threat and blackmail, not content with painting them as "voluntary defectors", a thrice-cursed atrocity.
					
					 The statement demanded the south Korean regime make an apology for its hideous human rights abuse and immediately send the abductees back home.
					
					 All Korean youths and students in Japan will stage a dynamic struggle to intensify solidarity and alliance with youths and students in the north, the south and abroad and join foreign youths and students including those in Japan in the actions to foil the south Korean regime's moves for confrontation with the compatriots in the north and seek the repatriation of the DPRK citizens, it noted.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un's Election as Chairman of WPK Celebrated by Chongryon Organizations
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un's Election as Chairman of WPK Celebrated by Chongryon Organizations
 Pyongyang, May 29 (KCNA) -- There took place meetings by the organizations of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan (Chongryon) to celebrate the election of supreme leader Kim Jong Un as chairman of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK).
					 The Osaka Prefectural Headquarters of Chongryon held a meeting in the Korean Hall in Osaka on May 24.
					
					 Pu Yong Uk, chairman of the headquarters, in a report said that Kim Jong Un was elected chairman of the WPK at its Seventh Congress.
					
					 He stressed the need to hold Kim Jong Un with loyalty to the last as he is leading the Korean nation to victory.
					
					 He called for splendidly decorating this significant year when the Seventh Congress of the WPK was held as a year for further demonstrating the might of Chongryon which has grown under the care of the great leaders.
					
					 The Hokkaido Prefectural Headquarters of Chongryon held a meeting at the hall of the headquarters on the same day.
					
					 Similar meetings took place at the Hyogo, Fukuoka and Aichi prefectural headquarters on May 21 and 22.
					
					 Letters to Kim Jong Un were read out at the meetings.

articles.title: Russian Newspaper Introduces DPRK's True Picture
articles.content:
Russian Newspaper Introduces DPRK's True Picture
 Pyongyang, May 29 (KCNA) -- The Russian newspaper Zavtra No. 19 carried an article titled "A power in the East" written by its deputy editor Andrei Fefelov.
					 The article said:
					
					 The Seventh Congress of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK) was successfully held.
					
					 For the country, which is not big in its territory but advancing purposefully, this marked an epoch-making event.
					
					 The power in the East has made steady progress and is ready to weather any ordeal.
					
					 The Korean people united like a clenched fist have brought about excellent results through a high-pitched labor drive.
					
					 Even after the said congress which marked a historic watershed, the Korean people will continue their dynamic charge for building a land of bliss.
					
					 The indomitable will of the Korean people and the orderly and well-organized ranks and cheers, passion and militant salute to their young leader at the Pyongyang mass rally and public procession celebrating the Seventh Congress of the WPK clearly demonstrated the invincibility of the country.
					
					 The Korean people's songs respecting the great leaders and dynamic and exciting songs are now heard in the DPRK to spur the drive for creation.
					
					 The DPRK, a power in the East, is dynamically advancing, demonstrating its perseverance and purposefulness despite the vicious moves to isolate and stifle it.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un's Election as Chairman of WPK Hailed in Russia, Nigeria
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un's Election as Chairman of WPK Hailed in Russia, Nigeria
 Pyongyang, May 29 (KCNA) -- A meeting was held by the Russian Khabarovsk Territorial Society for the Study of the Juche Idea and Experience in Socialist Construction of the DPRK, a book exhibition at a Koryo healthcare center in Nigeria and film shows at hospitals in Nigeria from May 19 to 24 to congratulate Marshal Kim Jong Un on his election as chairman of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK).
					 On display at the venue of the book exhibition were publications introducing the DPRK's true picture.
					
					 The participants of the film shows watched "The Monument to Party Founding" and other Korean films.
					
					 The chairperson of the above-said Russian society said that Kim Jong Un's election as chairman of the WPK was an event of very weighty significance in carrying out the cause of the Juche revolution, adding:
					
					 The DPRK's socialist cause is making a long drive entirely because the issue of succession to the leadership was successfully solved.
					
					 Under his leadership, the WPK and Korean people will carry out the tasks set forth at the congress and build a thriving socialist nation without fail.
					
					 A congratulatory message to Kim Jong Un was adopted at the meeting held in Russia.

articles.title: DPRK's Architecture Introduced by U.S. Newspaper
articles.content:
DPRK's Architecture Introduced by U.S. Newspaper
 Pyongyang, May 29 (KCNA) -- The Los Angeles Times posted an article introducing the architecture in the DPRK on its website on May 20.
					 The article said:
					
					 Dozens of modern apartment buildings and service centers including 53-storied skyscraper of fantastic shape stand in rows in Mirae Scientists Street and they shed brilliant rays over the wave of the Taedong River.
					
					 There is the Sci-Tech Complex, a splendid edifice built in the shape of a huge structure of atom, on Ssuk Islet a little away from the above-said street.
					
					 Magnificent buildings were built and large green areas laid out as befitting the socialist city of Pyongyang which had been reduced to debris during the Korean war in the 1950s.
					
					 In recent years Kim Jong Un, supreme leader of north Korea, has given the city facelift despite international sanctions.
					
					 In a word, the brightly lit city is undergoing facelift thanks to unique ideas.
					
					 The article referred to the fact that cultural and welfare facilities for people such as wading pool, fun fair and ski resort were successfully built along with modern streets across the country and a terminal of Pyongyang International Airport was built in a magnificent and fashionable style under the leadership of Kim Jong Un.
					
					 Pyongyang-style architecture is drawing the attention of foreign architects and students, it stressed, adding:
					
					 An Italian architect was so impressed to visit Pyongyang that he published a book introducing it as a model city.
